detaileddescription.para:
Signal function of the canvas
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
sign
a signal type from lv_signal_t enum
param
pointer to a signal specific variable
LV_RES_OK: the object is not deleted in the function; LV_RES_INV: the object is deleted

Create a canvas object
par
pointer to an object, it will be the parent of the new canvas
copy
pointer to a canvas object, if not NULL then the new object will be copied from it
pointer to the created canvas

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *canvas, void *buf, lv_coord_t w, lv_coord_t h, lv_img_cf_t cf)
memberdef.name: lv_canvas_set_buffer

detaileddescription.para:
Set a buffer for the canvas.
buf
a buffer where the content of the canvas will be. The required size is (lv_img_color_format_get_px_size(cf) * w * h) / 8) It can be allocated with lv_mem_alloc() or it can be statically allocated array (e.g. static lv_color_t buf[100*50]) or it can be an address in RAM or external SRAM
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
w
width of the canvas
h
height of the canvas
cf
color format. The following formats are supported: LV_IMG_CF_TRUE_COLOR, LV_IMG_CF_TRUE_COLOR_CHROMA_KEYED, LV_IMG_CF_INDEXES_1/2/4/8BIT

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *canvas, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_color_t c)
memberdef.name: lv_canvas_set_px

detaileddescription.para:
Set the color of a pixel on the canvas
canvas
pointer to canvas object
x
x coordinate of the point to set
y
x coordinate of the point to set
c
color of the point

Set the palette color of a canvas with index format. Valid only for LV_IMG_CF_INDEXED1/2/4/8
canvas
pointer to canvas object
id
the palette color to set:
for LV_IMG_CF_INDEXED1: 0..1
for LV_IMG_CF_INDEXED2: 0..3
for LV_IMG_CF_INDEXED4: 0..15
for LV_IMG_CF_INDEXED8: 0..255
c
the color to set

Set a style of a canvas.
canvas
pointer to canvas object
type
which style should be set
style
pointer to a style

Get the color of a pixel on the canvas
canvas
x
x coordinate of the point to set
y
x coordinate of the point to set
color of the point

Get the image of the canvas as a pointer to an lv_img_dsc_t variable.
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
pointer to the image descriptor.

Get style of a canvas.
canvas
pointer to canvas object
type
which style should be get
style pointer to the style

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *canvas, const void *to_copy, lv_coord_t w, lv_coord_t h, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y)
memberdef.name: lv_canvas_copy_buf

detaileddescription.para:
Copy a buffer to the canvas
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
to_copy
buffer to copy. The color format has to match with the canvas's buffer color format
w
width of the buffer to copy
h
height of the buffer to copy
x
left side of the destination position
y
top side of the destination position

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *canvas, lv_img_dsc_t *img, int16_t angle, lv_coord_t offset_x, lv_coord_t offset_y, int32_t pivot_x, int32_t pivot_y)
memberdef.name: lv_canvas_rotate

detaileddescription.para:
Rotate and image and store the result on a canvas.
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
img
pointer to an image descriptor. Can be the image descriptor of an other canvas too (lv_canvas_get_img()).
angle
the angle of rotation (0..360);
offset_x
offset X to tell where to put the result data on destination canvas
offset_y
offset X to tell where to put the result data on destination canvas
pivot_x
pivot X of rotation. Relative to the source canvas Set to source width / 2 to rotate around the center
pivot_y
pivot Y of rotation. Relative to the source canvas Set to source height / 2 to rotate around the center

Fill the canvas with color
canvas
pointer to a canvas
color
the background color

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *canvas, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_coord_t w, lv_coord_t h, const lv_style_t *style)
memberdef.name: lv_canvas_draw_rect

detaileddescription.para:
Draw a rectangle on the canvas
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
x
left coordinate of the rectangle
y
top coordinate of the rectangle
w
width of the rectangle
h
height of the rectangle
style
style of the rectangle (body properties are used except padding)

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *canvas, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_coord_t max_w, const lv_style_t *style, const char *txt, lv_label_align_t align)
memberdef.name: lv_canvas_draw_text

detaileddescription.para:
Draw a text on the canvas.
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
x
left coordinate of the text
y
top coordinate of the text
max_w
max width of the text. The text will be wrapped to fit into this size
style
style of the text (text properties are used)
txt
text to display
align
align of the text (LV_LABEL_ALIGN_LEFT/RIGHT/CENTER)

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *canvas, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, const void *src, const lv_style_t *style)
memberdef.name: lv_canvas_draw_img

detaileddescription.para:
Draw an image on the canvas
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
src
image source. Can be a pointer an lv_img_dsc_t variable or a path an image.
style
style of the image (image properties are used)

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *canvas, const lv_point_t *points, uint32_t point_cnt, const lv_style_t *style)
memberdef.name: lv_canvas_draw_line

detaileddescription.para:
Draw a line on the canvas
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
points
point of the line
point_cnt
number of points
style
style of the line (line properties are used)

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *canvas, const lv_point_t *points, uint32_t point_cnt, const lv_style_t *style)
memberdef.name: lv_canvas_draw_polygon

detaileddescription.para:
Draw a polygon on the canvas
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
points
point of the polygon
point_cnt
number of points
style
style of the polygon (body.main_color and body.opa is used)

memberdef.argsstring: (lv_obj_t *canvas, lv_coord_t x, lv_coord_t y, lv_coord_t r, int32_t start_angle, int32_t end_angle, const lv_style_t *style)
memberdef.name: lv_canvas_draw_arc

detaileddescription.para:
Draw an arc on the canvas
canvas
pointer to a canvas object
x
origo x of the arc
y
origo y of the arc
r
radius of the arc
start_angle
start angle in degrees
end_angle
end angle in degrees
style
style of the polygon (body.main_color and body.opa is used)
